metadata.title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a danglingpointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited byProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write intofreed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems wherethe X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

criterions.comment: xorg-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
